result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin David Reissing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Colin David Reissing is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Colin David Reissing was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colin David Reissing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Colin David Reissing appeared by video.  Attorney Colleen Cullen appeared by video for Colin David Reissing.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 2: 
On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, Co. Ord. 63.01 to which defendant pled guilty.
Court found defendant guilty and ordered a judgment of conviction and ordered the defendant to pay a forfeiture of $200.00 all costs and surcharges by 1-3-2023; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.

AS TO COUNT 1: Per plea negotiations and on the State's motion, Court ordered dismissed.
Certificate of Completion, filed.
filed.

Defendant Colin David Reissing in court.  Attorney Colleen Cullen in court for Colin David Reissing.  Attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Case is adjourned to 10-4-22 at 2:00 pm for plea and sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Colin David Reissing in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Parties ready to proceed to trial. Court unable to hear case for reasons stated off the record. No spins available. Case adjourned in Branch 10.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion to Adjourn, filed.
filed.

Defendant Colin David Reissing in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting a jury trial date.  Case is adjourned to 7-13-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion In Limine, filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Defense Proposed Jury Instructions, filed.
filed.

CORRECTION: Entry from 3-16-2022 states that cash bail was forfeited. This was an error. Cash bail was not posted. Information from the Sheriff's Department indicated the defendant had posted $250 cash. Defendant had a $250.00 signature bond from case 19CM3460 which was reissued as this case, 22CM496. The Commisioner ordered a new signature bond on this case in the amount of $250.00. Nothing is to be returned as previously stated as there is no cash bail.

Defendant previously posted $250 that was ordered forfeited. Court orders the $250.00 be returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MAT.

Defendant Colin David Reissing in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/19/22 @ 1:30p
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Colin David Reissing not in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/16/22 @ 1p
